title: CIA Directorate of Operations layoffs under DCI Stansfield Turner ('Halloween Massacre')
summary:
Director of Central Intelligence Stansfield Turner oversaw significant
reductions in CIA clandestine service personnel in 1977, including the
dismissal/retirement of hundreds of case officers. Contemporary coverage and
declassified records show the move aimed to shift resources toward technical
collection and reduce legacy covert capabilities; critics called it a
"Halloween Massacre."
